title: The Myth Makers
dialogue_triumphs: The Doctor (on Hector): 'You have killed this poor fellow!' Achilles (thinking the Doctor is Zeus): 'Ah, but in your name!'
dialogue_disasters: Cassandra: 'Woe to Troy!' Paris: 'It's too late to say "whoa!" to the horse.'

A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum

locations.name: Troy
locations.description: Ancient city in Asia Minor, site of the Trojan War

additional_notes: The story concentrates on perceptions of history, noting that Troilus and Cressida derive from medieval romance rather than classical legend.
bottom_line: The massacre of Trojan soldiers and some reasonable fight sequences form the odd back-drop to a 'high comedy' that concentrates on perceptions of history. Despite the presence of some fine actors the whole thing feels uneasy.
